column4: are there any new media players on ubuntu that are as bloated, and integrated, as Windows Media Player yet?
jrpg, odd. I havn't found a way to burn a disk with amarok from within amarok.

I use mplayer. I have a user who won't switch to anything that doesn't have Windows Media Player 9, though. I'm wanting something I can use as an easy transition. Something more like WM9 than WM11, really.
